  <header role="banner">
    <h1 class="sr-only">Department of Ethnic Studies - College of Letters and Science - University of California, Berkeley</h1>
    
    
      <div class="visible-xs link-back pull-right"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

      <div id='main-content' class="main-content" role="main">
        <div class="row">
          <aside aria-label="Left Sidebar">
           <div class="col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 sidebar-left">
            <div class="hidden-xs">
              


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>
      
    
  </ul>

            </div>
            <div class="hidden-xs">
              
            </div>
            </div>
          </aside>
          <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-9 col-xs-12">
            <section aria-label="Main Content">
            <div class="body-area">
              <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
              <div class="body-head">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371839' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371839'>
  <h1>
    Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies
  </h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371839 -->
              </div>
              <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
                <div class="mobile-left">
                  


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>
      
    
  </ul>

                </div>
              </div>
              <div class="body-main">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371837' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371837'></div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371837 -->
                
  <p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:14px;">The Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies Program (AAADS) is dedicated to the interdisciplinary study of historical and contemporary experiences of Americans of Asian ancestry, and the framing of this knowledge and critical understanding within local, national, and global contexts. Tracing its genealogy to the Third World Strike and the formation of the field of Ethnic Studies in the late 1960s and early 1970s, the Asian American Studies program initially centered on domestic U.S. concerns regarding the political, economic, and cultural challenges confronting people of Asian descent and their struggles for inclusion and advancement in U.S. society. While retaining its original commitment to community empowerment through socially engaged research, teaching, and service, the program has broadened its scope to encompass issues of transnationality and diaspora in response to geopolitical and demographic shifts.</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color: rgb(105, 105, 105);"><font face="arial, helvetica, sans-serif">Reflecting the collective strengths of our faculty, our curriculum offers students a deeper&nbsp;understanding of&nbsp;the histories and contemporary realities of&nbsp;the different&nbsp;ethnic groups that comprise the &quot;Asian American&quot; category. Through classroom-based and experiential learning, our&nbsp;students engage with critical issues such as labor, migration, health, representation and cultural production, education, religion, class, gender, generation, law, public policy, and social activism.</font></span></span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color: rgb(105, 105, 105);">*For more information about and to donate to the AAADS </span>50th Anniversary Fundraising Campaign <a href="http://aaads.berkeley.edu/give/">click here</a></span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph">
<style type="text/css">
</style>
</p>

  
  
    <h3>Faculty in Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</h3>
    <ul class="person_list list-unstyled">
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/hatem-bazian"><b>Hatem Bazian</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Muslim American Studies; Colonialism and Post-Colonial Studies; Arab and Arab American Studies; Critical Race Theory; Palestine Studies; Comparative Liberation Theologies
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/catherine-ceniza-choy"><b>Catherine Ceniza Choy</b></a>, Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Asian American History; Philippine and Filipino American Studies; Adoption; Nursing; Migration; Gender
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/carolyn-chen-1"><b>Carolyn Chen</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Religion, Race, Ethnicity, Immigration
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/harvey-dong"><b>Harvey Dong</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                History (Asian American, Chinese American), Contemporary Community Issues
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/lisa-hiraitsuchitani"><b>Lisa Hirai Tsuchitani</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Japanese American History, API Educational Issues
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/anna-leong"><b>Anna Leong</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Writing instruction, Asian American literature, Ethnic American literature
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/michael-omi-1"><b>Michael Omi</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Racial Theory and Politics, Racial/Ethnic Classification and Identity, Comparative Racialization
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/lok-siu-1"><b>Lok Siu</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Transnationalism; Migration; Cultural Citizenship; Un/Belonging; Racial, Ethnic, and Gender Formation; Asians in the Americas; Cultural Politics of Food; Ethnography
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/khatharya-um-1"><b>Khatharya Um</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Southeast Asian and Southeast Asian American Studies, refugee migration, transnational and diaspora studies, post-colonial, conflict and post conflict studies and genocide studies, access and education of racialized minorities in American public schools
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/keiko-yamanaka"><b>Keiko Yamanaka</b></a>, Continuing Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                gender & generation, transnational migration in Asia
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
    </ul>
  

              </div>
              <div class="text-right link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>

      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

      <div id='main-content' class="main-content" role="main">
        <div class="row">
          <aside aria-label="Left Sidebar">
           <div class="col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 sidebar-left">
            <div class="hidden-xs">
              


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>

          <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-9 col-xs-12">
            <section aria-label="Main Content">
            <div class="body-area">
              <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
              <div class="body-head">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371839' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371839'>
  <h1>
    Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies
  </h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371839 -->
              </div>
              <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
                <div class="mobile-left">
                  


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>
      
    
  </ul>

                </div>
              </div>
              <div class="body-main">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371837' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371837'></div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371837 -->
                
  <p style="text-align: justify;">The Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies Program is grounded in the decolonization and liberation projects of U.S. Latina/os and their allies in the civil rights, gender, and sexual liberation movements of the 1960s that continue through the present in new forms that address new conditions. Our courses on the U.S. Latina/o experience continue the historic mission of contributing to the production of truly universal knowledges about the United States and an increasingly interconnected world beyond the limited scope of Eurocentric or other ethnocentric perspectives and the disciplinary constraints in traditional fields of the humanities and social sciences. To achieve this we take seriously the knowledges, epistemologies and critical thinking produced by racially and sexually oppressed subjects, and we endeavor to examine the entangled intersectionality of racialized sexuality, gender, and class in complex socio-historical processes. &nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">We also engage comparative U.S. ethnic, hemispheric Americas, and global comparative studies to trace the movement of Latina/o communities and their cultures.&nbsp; As an interdisciplinary group of scholars, we offer courses in the social sciences, geography, history, literature, visual cultural studies, performance arts, public policy, education, health, theater, film, media, religion, and philosophy. In addition, we offer practicum courses in creative writing, research methods, visual and performance arts and field studies/internship experience in various community organizations.</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph">
<style type="text/css">
</style>
<style type="text/css">
</style>
</p>

  
  
    <h3>Faculty in Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</h3>
    <ul class="person_list list-unstyled">
      
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/raul-coronado-1"><b>Ral Coronado</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                The comparative history of writing in the colonial and 19th century Americas; Latina/o intellectual & literary history; theories of modernity & postcolonialism; histories of sexuality & of the academic disciplines
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/pablo-gonzalez-1"><b>Pablo Gonzalez</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Social movements, Urban Anthropology, Borderlands Anthropology, Decolonial Thought and Praxis, Criminality and Illegality, Chicana/o Studies, Critical Race Theory/Praxis, and the study of Commons/Enclosures.
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/ramon-grosfoguel-1"><b>Ramon Grosfoguel</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Decoloniality; International Migration; Political-Economy of the World-System; Racism; Islamophobia
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/celia-herrera-rodriguez"><b>Celia Herrera Rodriguez</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Xicana Indigena Art Theory, History, and Practice
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/laura-perez-1"><b>Laura E. Prez</b></a>, Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Post-sixties U.S. Latina/o literary, visual, and performance arts; U.S. women of color femininist and queer thought; decolonial spiritualities, decolonial aesthetics.
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/ray-telles"><b>Ray Telles</b></a>, Associate Adjunct Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Chicano Film
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/chris-zepeda-millan"><b>Chris Zepeda-Millan</b></a>, Assistant Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Social Movements; Immigration; Race & Ethnic Politics; Public Opinion; Interdisiplinary Research Methods
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
    </ul>
  

              </div>
              <div class="text-right link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>
</div>
            </div>
          </section>

</div>
      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

      <div id='main-content' class="main-content" role="main">
        <div class="row">
          <aside aria-label="Left Sidebar">
           <div class="col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 sidebar-left">
            <div class="hidden-xs">
              


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>

          <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-9 col-xs-12">
            <section aria-label="Main Content">
            <div class="body-area">
              <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
              <div class="body-head">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371839' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371839'>
  <h1>
    Comparative Ethnic Studies
  </h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371839 -->
              </div>
              <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
                <div class="mobile-left">
                  


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>
      
    
  </ul>

                </div>
              </div>
              <div class="body-main">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371837' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371837'></div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371837 -->
                
  <p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:14px;">The study of race should be grounded in a deep understanding of the particular historical, social, economic, cultural, and political experiences of individual racialized groups as well as an analysis of the relationships among them.&nbsp; Established in 1975, our Comparative Ethnic Studies (CES) program builds on and extends beyond the groups covered in our other majors by analyzing the multiple and intersectional ways in which groups are racialized, operate within and contest various forms of power, and build alliances. Collectively our faculty provide a wide range of interdisciplinary analyses across geographical areas, among various racialized peoples, and with other markers of social difference such as gender, class, and sexuality.&nbsp; Our CES program enriches the study of individual racialized and indigenous groups and has long provided a model for the development of other Ethnic Studies departments across the country.</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph">
<style type="text/css">
</style>
</p>

  
  
    <h3>Faculty in Comparative Ethnic Studies</h3>
    <ul class="person_list list-unstyled">
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/tom-biolsi"><b>Thomas Biolsi</b></a>, Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Race-Making, Indian Law & Policy, Governmentality
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/michael-chang"><b>Michael Chang</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Law, race, and culture; civil rights; critical race theory; Ethnic Studies; Asian American Studies;  Diaspora Studies; Post-colonial Studies; Education Law; Administrative law.
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/greg-choy"><b>Greg Choy</b></a>, Continuing Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Comparative Multiethnic literature, Asian American literature, Education pedagogy
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/raul-coronado-1"><b>Ral Coronado</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                The comparative history of writing in the colonial and 19th century Americas; Latina/o intellectual & literary history; theories of modernity & postcolonialism; histories of sexuality & of the academic disciplines
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/keith-feldman-1"><b>Keith Feldman</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Theories of Race, Nation, and Empire; Cultural Theory; African, Arab, and Jewish Diasporas; Visual Culture Studies; Transnational American Studies
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/christian-paiz"><b>Christian Paiz</b></a>, Assistant Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Comparative Latino Studies, United States History, Social Movement History, Historical Methods
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/john-a-powell"><b>john a. powell</b></a>, Professor of Ethnic Studies, African American Studies, and Law
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Civil Rights & Civil Liberties; Structural Racism; Housing; Poverty; Democracy
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/victoria-robinson"><b>Victoria Robinson</b></a>, Lecturer & American Cultures Program Director
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Immigration
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/juana-maria-rodriguez"><b>Juana Mara Rodrguez</b></a>, Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                racialized gender and sexuality; Latinx media and popular culture; critical legal theory; LGBTQ activisms
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/chris-zepeda-millan"><b>Chris Zepeda-Millan</b></a>, Assistant Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Social Movements; Immigration; Race & Ethnic Politics; Public Opinion; Interdisiplinary Research Methods
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
    </ul>
  

              </div>
              <div class="text-right link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>
</div>
            </div>
          </section>

                        <ul class='dropdown-menu'>

    <h1 class="sr-only">Department of Ethnic Studies - College of Letters and Science - University of California, Berkeley</h1>
    
    
      <div class="visible-xs link-back pull-right"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

      <div id='main-content' class="main-content" role="main">
        <div class="row">
          <aside aria-label="Left Sidebar">
           <div class="col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12 sidebar-left">
            <div class="hidden-xs">
              


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>

            </div>
            </div>
          </aside>
          <div class="col-md-8 col-sm-9 col-xs-12">
            <section aria-label="Main Content">
            <div class="body-area">
              <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
              <div class="body-head">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371839' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371839'>
  <h1>
    Native American Studies
  </h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371839 -->
              </div>
              <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
                <div class="mobile-left">
                  


  <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav">
    <li class="sidenav-heading">Areas of Study</li>
    
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/ethnic-studies">Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/asian-studies">Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="" href="/areas-of-study/area/chicano-latino-studies">Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
      
    
      
        <li class="sidenav-link"><a class="active" href="/areas-of-study/area/native-american-studies">Native American Studies</a></li>
      
    
  </ul>

                </div>
              </div>
              <div class="body-main">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3371837' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3371837'></div>
<!-- end code region pod_3371837 -->
                
  <p style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph">
<style type="text/css">
</style>
<style type="text/css">
</style>
The specificity of the Native American situation must be understood in terms of indigeneity and the colonial forces confronting it. Any engaged understanding of Native people&mdash;historical or contemporary&mdash;must start from the fact of their prior presence as autonomous societies with relationships to the land. From this foundation follows the significance of colonialism, and particularly settler colonialism, as the primary form of domination confronted by Native peoples in ongoing struggles for justice.</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph">Our Native American Studies program considers broadly the relationship of indigeneity and settler colonialism, foregrounding the historical contexts and constraints through which indigenous individuals and polities have expressed and continue to express themselves. Indigenous epistemologies, histories, languages, cultural texts and social practices are key arenas of analysis as we examine the unique experiences of Native Americans. Grounded in the study of history, culture, language, law and policy, the frameworks that enrich our research include comparative global indigenous studies, women and gender studies, queer studies, subaltern studies, immigrant and refugee histories, and transnational and diasporic studies.&nbsp;</p>

  
  
    <h3>Faculty in Native American Studies</h3>
    <ul class="person_list list-unstyled">
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/joellen-anderson"><b>JoEllen Anderson</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Tribal Histories, Indigenous Politics, Education, Film & Literature
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/tom-biolsi"><b>Thomas Biolsi</b></a>, Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Race-Making, Indian Law & Policy, Governmentality
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/shari-huhndorf"><b>Shari Huhndorf</b></a>, Class of 1938 Professor and Department Chair
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Interdisciplinary Native American studies, literary and visual culture, cultural studies, gender studies, American studies
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/enrique-lima"><b>Enrique Lima</b></a>, Lecturer
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Native American Literature and History; Transnational Indigenous Issues; Theory and History of the Novel
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
          
        
      
        
          
            <li>
              <div class="person-heading">
                <a href="/people/faculty-profile/beth-piatote-1"><b>Beth Piatote</b></a>, Associate Professor
              </div>
              <div class="person-detail">
                Native American literature, history, law and culture; Native American/Aboriginal literature and federal Indian law in the United States and Canada; American literature and cultural studies; Ni:mi:pu: (Nez Perce) language and literature
              </div>
            </li>
          
        
      
    </ul>
  

              </div>
              <div class="text-right link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>
</div>
            </div>
          </section>
          </div>

  <header role="banner">
    <h1 class="sr-only">Department of Ethnic Studies - College of Letters and Science - University of California, Berkeley</h1>

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

<h1>Spring 2018</h1>

<!-- end code region pod_3229389 -->

            <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">

  <ul class="sidenav list-unstyled">

            <!--





  







Select: course_level:graduate&&year:2018&&semester:SP








-->
  
<ul class="course-list list-unstyled divided-list">  
    
    <hr>
    <li class="" id="ccn-32223">
      <!-- begin edit region 'kdb_id_3664068'--> <div id='kdb_id_3664068' class='kb_type_dynode wv-edit-region '>
        <article id="3664068-series-in-comparative-transnational-theories-and">
          <h3 class="sr-only">Series in Comparative Transnational Theories and Methods---Transnational Paradigms in Ethnic Studies</h3>
          <h4 role="presentation">ETHSTD 240 001 | CCN: 32223</h4>
          <header><h3><a href="/course-information/3664068-series-in-comparative-transnational-theories-and">Series in Comparative Transnational Theories and Methods---Transnational Paradigms in Ethnic Studies<span class="sr-only"> - CCN#32223</span></a></h3></header>
          <p class="professor">
            Instructor: 
            <a href="/faculty-profile/ramon-grosfoguel-1">Ramon Grosfoguel</a>
            
          </p>
          <p class="times">Tu 4:00 pm - 6:59 pm  Dwinelle 134 </p>
          <p>Research seminar focus is on critical theories and practices in transnational comparative frameworks.
 <span class="more"><a href="/course-information/3664068-series-in-comparative-transnational-theories-and" aria-label="Series in Comparative Transnational Theories and Methods---Transnational Paradigms in Ethnic Studies - 32223"><strong> More</strong><span class="sr-only"> information on Series in Comparative Transnational Theories and Methods---Transnational Paradigms in Ethnic Studies (32223)</span></a></span></p>
        </article>
      </div> <!-- end edit region 'kdb_id_3664068'-->
    </li>    
    
    
    <li class="" id="ccn-32943">
      <!-- begin edit region 'kdb_id_3664070'--> <div id='kdb_id_3664070' class='kb_type_dynode wv-edit-region '>
        <article id="3664070-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics-religion">
          <h3 class="sr-only">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---Religion, Race and Ethnicity</h3>
          <h4 role="presentation">ETHSTD 250 001 | CCN: 32943</h4>
          <header><h3><a href="/course-information/3664070-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics-religion">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---Religion, Race and Ethnicity<span class="sr-only"> - CCN#32943</span></a></h3></header>
          <p class="professor">
            Instructor: 
            <a href="/faculty-profile/carolyn-chen-1">Carolyn Chen</a>
            
          </p>
          <p class="times">W 2:00 pm - 4:59 pm  Dwinelle 104 </p>
          <p>What does religion have to do with race and ethnicity? This course offers a social scientific examination of the relationship between religion, race, and ethnicity in the United States. Despite classical social theory&rsquo;s predictions of their  <span class="more"><a href="/course-information/3664070-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics-religion" aria-label="Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---Religion, Race and Ethnicity - 32943"><strong> More</strong><span class="sr-only"> information on Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---Religion, Race and Ethnicity (32943)</span></a></span></p>
        </article>
      </div> <!-- end edit region 'kdb_id_3664070'-->
    </li>    
    
    
    <li class="" id="ccn-39774">
      <!-- begin edit region 'kdb_id_3664072'--> <div id='kdb_id_3664072' class='kb_type_dynode wv-edit-region '>
        <article id="3664072-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">
          <h3 class="sr-only">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Critical Ethnic Studies without Guarantees: Thinking with Stuart Hall.</h3>
          <h4 role="presentation">ETHSTD 250 002 | CCN: 39774</h4>
          <header><h3><a href="/course-information/3664072-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Critical Ethnic Studies without Guarantees: Thinking with Stuart Hall.<span class="sr-only"> - CCN#39774</span></a></h3></header>
          <p class="professor">
            Instructor: 
            <a href="/faculty-profile/keith-feldman-1">Keith Feldman</a>
            
          </p>
          <p class="times">Tu 11:00 am - 1:59 pm  Barrows 591</p>
          <p>A seminar course designed to involve Ethnic Studies students directly in the research process. Emphasis on examination and analysis of primary sources, methodology, and the development of theoretical constructs. A major research paper is required.
 <span class="more"><a href="/course-information/3664072-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics" aria-label="Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Critical Ethnic Studies without Guarantees: Thinking with Stuart Hall. - 39774"><strong> More</strong><span class="sr-only"> information on Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Critical Ethnic Studies without Guarantees: Thinking with Stuart Hall. (39774)</span></a></span></p>
        </article>
      </div> <!-- end edit region 'kdb_id_3664072'-->
    </li>    
    
    
    <li class="" id="ccn-39775">
      <!-- begin edit region 'kdb_id_3664075'--> <div id='kdb_id_3664075' class='kb_type_dynode wv-edit-region '>
        <article id="3664075-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">
          <h3 class="sr-only">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Immigrant Rights & Activism: From Theory to Practice</h3>
          <h4 role="presentation">ETHSTD 250 003 | CCN: 39775</h4>
          <header><h3><a href="/course-information/3664075-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Immigrant Rights & Activism: From Theory to Practice<span class="sr-only"> - CCN#39775</span></a></h3></header>
          <p class="professor">
            Instructor: 
            <a href="/faculty-profile/chris-zepeda-millan">Chris Zepeda-Millan</a>
            
          </p>
          <p class="times"> W 11:00 am - 1:59 pm This class will be held at the Shorb House:  2547 Channing Way, Berkeley, CA 94720</p>
          <p>This interdisciplinary graduate seminar examines immigrant rights activism in theory and practice. Beginning with close readings of key texts in citizenship theory (e.g., by Benhabib, Honig, Boskniak, Carens, etc.), the bulk of the course will  <span class="more"><a href="/course-information/3664075-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics" aria-label="Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Immigrant Rights & Activism: From Theory to Practice - 39775"><strong> More</strong><span class="sr-only"> information on Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics---  Immigrant Rights & Activism: From Theory to Practice (39775)</span></a></span></p>
        </article>
      </div> <!-- end edit region 'kdb_id_3664075'-->
    </li>    
    
    
    <li class="" id="ccn-40850">
      <!-- begin edit region 'kdb_id_3664078'--> <div id='kdb_id_3664078' class='kb_type_dynode wv-edit-region '>
        <article id="3664078-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">
          <h3 class="sr-only">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics--- National Bodies, Sexual Subjects</h3>
          <h4 role="presentation">ETHSTD 250 004 | CCN: 40850</h4>
          <header><h3><a href="/course-information/3664078-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics">Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics--- National Bodies, Sexual Subjects<span class="sr-only"> - CCN#40850</span></a></h3></header>
          <p class="professor">
            Instructor: 
            <a href="/faculty-profile/juana-maria-rodriguez">Juana Mara Rodrguez</a>
            
          </p>
          <p class="times">M 11:00 am - 1:59 pm  This class will be held at the Shorb House:  2547 Channing Way, Berkeley, CA 94720</p>
          <p>This class will interrogate how sexual subjects and the subjects of sex disrupt projects of subjectivity, identity, and nation. Drawing on performance studies, law, queer of color critique, disability studies and critical theories of discipline,  <span class="more"><a href="/course-information/3664078-research-seminar-selected-issues-and-topics" aria-label="Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics--- National Bodies, Sexual Subjects - 40850"><strong> More</strong><span class="sr-only"> information on Research Seminar: Selected Issues and Topics--- National Bodies, Sexual Subjects (40850)</span></a></span></p>
        </article>
      </div> <!-- end edit region 'kdb_id_3664078'-->
    </li>    
  
  
</ul> 


            <div class="text-right hidden-xs link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>

                      <li class='dropdown'><a href='#' data-toggle="dropdown" class="dropdown-toggle">Areas of Study</a>
                        <ul class='dropdown-menu'>

      <div class="tight clearfix header">

            <div class="body-head">
              <!-- begin code region 'pod_3166772' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3166772 wv-inplace-rte'><p class="h2">Programs <span>/ Graduate</span></p>

<h1>International Student Information</h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3166772 -->
            </div>
            <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
              <div class="mobile-left">
                

  
  
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav ">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/undergrad">Undergraduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='#'>Major and Minor Requirements</a>
              
                       
                		<ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/comparative-ethnic-studies-major'>Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/asian-american-asian-diaspora-studies-major'>Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/chicano-latino-studies-major'>Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/native-american-studies-major'>Native American Studies</a></li>
                  			
                		</ul>
           			 
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/internships'>Internships</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/student-learning-outcomes'>Student Learning Outcomes</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/resources'>Undergraduate Resources & Forms</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/advising'>Advising</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/careers'>Careers in Ethnic Studies</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                </ul>
            
          </li>
        </ul>
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav active-sidenav">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/grad">Graduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav active-subnav list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/admissions'>Graduate Admissions</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/tuition-financial-aid'>Tuition and Financial Aid</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/resources'>Resources & Forms</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>

            <!-- begin code region 'pod_3166770' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3166770 wv-inplace-rte'><p style="text-align: justify;">If you are considering graduate study as an international student at the Berkeley campus, then please visit the following resources for additional information.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://internationaloffice.berkeley.edu/">Berkeley International Office</a> - Here, you will find information about visas, living at Berkeley as well as find valuable links relevant to anyone from abroad who is considering study or research at Berkeley as well as for those who are already here and need information on programs and workshops addressing international student needs.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/students/">Information for International Students</a> - This page is part of the Graduate Division&rsquo;s admissions information for prospective international students. Please review it for additional information on coming to Berkeley as a graduate student.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Additionally, if you intend to enroll in a Ph.D. program, such as ours, please note that international students must pay the non-resident tuition costs until they advance to candidacy. Once advanced to candidacy (usually at the end of the 3rd year of study), non-resident tuition is waived for international Ph.D. students. Until then, however, it is impossible to waive this significant fee. For a full listing of tuition and fees, please refer to the <a href="http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Default.aspx?PageID=feesched.html">registrar&rsquo;s information on fees</a>. Also, keep in mind that the campus uses specific dollar amounts to estimate an individual graduate student&rsquo;s budget for each academic year. International students must show proof of financial ability to cover each and every amount listed. <a href="http://financialaid.berkeley.edu/">Current year student budgets</a> are available for your information.</p>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3166770 -->

<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3029581'><p class="h2">Programs <span>/ Graduate</span></p>
<h1>Tuition and Financial Aid</h1>


</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3029581 -->
            </div>
            <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
              <div class="mobile-left">

            <!-- begin code region 'pod_3029579' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3029579 wv-inplace-rte'><p>To review the current year estimated cost of attendance, please go to the <a href="http://financialaid.berkeley.edu/#graduate">Financial Aid website</a> for complete details on student budgets:</p>

<p>Additionally, the Graduate Division has various resources.  Please review the links provided under the heading Financing a Berkeley Education. The Guide to Financial Support for Graduate Students, which youll find in the first link under the heading <a href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/choose-berkeley/">Financing a Berkeley Education</a> is especially important and relevant to anyone investigating how to fund their graduate education at Berkeley.  This guide will fully detail all funding options.</p>

<p>Also of particular importance is information on becoming a Graduate Student Instructor, Researcher or Reader, since these academic jobs often provide a generous tuition and fee remissions benefit. The Graduate Division has information on <a href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/financial/graduate-student-employment/">Teaching and Research Opportunities</a>.</p></div>
<!-- end code region pod_3029579 -->
            
            <div class="text-right hidden-xs link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>

              <span class="icon-bar"></span>
            </button>
          </div>

</div>
      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

            <section aria-label="Body">
            <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>

            <div class="body-head">
              <!-- begin code region 'pod_3167678' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3167678'><p class="h2">Programs <span>/ Graduate</span></p>
<h1>About</h1>


</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3167678 -->
            </div>
            <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
              <div class="mobile-left">
                

  
  
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav ">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/undergrad">Undergraduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='#'>Major and Minor Requirements</a>
              
                       
                		<ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/comparative-ethnic-studies-major'>Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/asian-american-asian-diaspora-studies-major'>Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/chicano-latino-studies-major'>Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/native-american-studies-major'>Native American Studies</a></li>
                  			
                		</ul>
           			 
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/internships'>Internships</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/student-learning-outcomes'>Student Learning Outcomes</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/resources'>Undergraduate Resources & Forms</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/advising'>Advising</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/careers'>Careers in Ethnic Studies</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                </ul>
            
          </li>
        </ul>
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav active-sidenav">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/grad">Graduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav active-subnav list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="active" href='/programs/grad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/admissions'>Graduate Admissions</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/tuition-financial-aid'>Tuition and Financial Aid</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/resources'>Resources & Forms</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/international'>International</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                </ul>
            
          </li>
        </ul>
      
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
  


              </div>
            </div>
            <!-- begin code region 'pod_3167676' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3167676 wv-inplace-rte'><p style="text-align: justify;">Founded in 1984, the graduate program in Ethnic Studies is the first interdisciplinary PhD program in the U.S. dedicated to the study of comparative race and ethnicity in national, hemispheric, and global contexts. It continues to be a premiere PhD program that provides rigorous interdisciplinary training as well as critical grounding in comparative, relational, and intersectional analysis made possible by the core subfields of the department&mdash;Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies, Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies, Native American Studies, and Comparative Ethnic Studies.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The graduate program draws on faculty strength in a wide range of fields, including studies of race, ethnicity, indigeneity, gender, and sexuality; citizenship, migration, and borders; diaspora and transnationalism; sovereignty and decoloniality; representation and performance; social movements and cultural politics; religion, food, museums, labor, and war. Students learn social science and humanities methodologies, including archival research, ethnography, oral history, and textual and visual analysis. Students also have the opportunity to pursue a &ldquo;<a href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/policy/degrees-policy/#f21-doctoral-degrees-with-a-designated-emphasis">Designated Emphasis</a>&rdquo; in such areas as Critical Theory, Film Studies, New Media, and Women, Gender, and Sexuality. For more information on program requirements, please refer to the <a href="/2015%20Graduate%20Handbook/2015%20Handbook%20Revision.pdf">Ethnic Studies Graduate Handbook</a>.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Our graduate program has trained generations of award-winning scholars, &nbsp;dedicated teachers and social-cultural critics who now work in a wide range of academic, cultural, private, and public institutions. Our graduate students continually receive the most prestigious national fellowships and awards, such as those granted by the Ford Foundation, the National Science Foundation (NSF), and the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, and have one of the highest placement rates (78.6%) among all UC Berkeley doctoral programs (57.2%).</p>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3167676 -->
            
            <div class="text-right hidden-xs link-top"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="#to-top"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-up"></span><span class="sr-only">To Page Top</span></a>
</div>
            </section>
          </div>

      <div class="tight clearfix header">
  <header role="banner">
    <h1 class="sr-only">Department of Ethnic Studies - College of Letters and Science - University of California, Berkeley</h1>
    
    
      <div class="visible-xs link-back pull-right"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>
</div>
      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
</div>

            <section aria-label="Body">
            <div class="body-area">
              <div class="link-back hidden-xs"><a class="btn btn-color btn-back" href="javascript:history.back()"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Page</span></a>

              <div class="body-head">
                <!-- begin code region 'pod_3411486' -->
<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3411486 wv-inplace-rte'>
<p class="h2">Programs / Graduate</p>

<h1>Admissions</h1>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3411486 -->
              </div>
              <div class="visible-xs clearfix tight">
                <div class="mobile-left">
                  

  
  
    
  
    
  
    
  
    
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav ">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/undergrad">Undergraduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='#'>Major and Minor Requirements</a>
              
                       
                		<ul class="subnav  list-unstyled">
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/comparative-ethnic-studies-major'>Comparative Ethnic Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/asian-american-asian-diaspora-studies-major'>Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/chicano-latino-studies-major'>Chicana/o and Latina/o Studies</a></li>
                  			
                    			<li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/major-requirements/native-american-studies-major'>Native American Studies</a></li>
                  			
                		</ul>
           			 
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/internships'>Internships</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/student-learning-outcomes'>Student Learning Outcomes</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/resources'>Undergraduate Resources & Forms</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/advising'>Advising</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/undergrad/careers'>Careers in Ethnic Studies</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                </ul>
            
          </li>
        </ul>
      
        <ul class="list-unstyled sidenav active-sidenav">
          <li class="parent-link"><a href="/programs/grad">Graduate Program</a>
            
            
                <ul class="subnav active-subnav list-unstyled">
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad'>About</a></li>
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="active" href='/programs/grad/admissions'>Graduate Admissions</a>
              
                       
                   
                    </li>                    
                  
                    <li class="sidenav-link"><a  class="" href='/programs/grad/tuition-financial-aid'>Tuition and Financial Aid</a>

<div class=' wv-code-region-pod_3411484 wv-inplace-rte'>
<ol>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#1">Application Materials and Deadline</a></p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#2">Criteria for Admission</a></p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#3">Program Requirements</a></p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#4">Financial Aid and Tuition</a></p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#5">STEP by Step</a></p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="#6">Questions?</a></p>
	</li>
</ol>

<h3 id="1" style="text-align: justify;">Application Materials and Deadline</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The University no longer utilizes a paper-based application system. Follow the link below for accessing the Graduate Divisions web site and online application for admissions:<br>
<a class="external" href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/apply/" target="_blank">http://www.grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/</a></p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>The deadline to submit ALL application materials for Fall 2018&nbsp;is Friday, December 1, 2017</strong>; we accept applications for the Fall Semester only. In addition to the university-wide application (there is no departmental application), the department requires a 20-page writing sample, original transcripts for all academic work completed, and a minimum of three (3) letters of recommendation from faculty members. We do not require the GRE examination for consideration for admissions. All applicants will automatically be considered for fellowship nomination.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Applications may be accessed on-line beginning September 1st. Please visit the <a class="external" href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/apply/" target="_blank">Graduate Division website</a>.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">International students, please see the <a href="/grad/international/International">Student Information page</a> for more details.</p>

<h3 id="2" style="text-align: justify;">Criteria for Admission</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">Applicants are evaluated on the basis of the following criteria:</p>

<ol>
	<li>
	<p><strong>Academic Achievements:</strong><br>
	These include but are not limited to undergraduate (and, if applicable, graduate) GPA, instructors' written evaluations on performance in coursework, academic honors received, publications, etc. GRE scores are not required. The typical minimum GPA is 3.0. If your GPA falls below 3.0, please provide an explanation in your statement of purpose. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p><strong>Statement of Purpose:</strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;The statement of purpose should give a clear description of the applicant's academic preparation and intellectual development, research interests, motivation for and commitment to graduate study in this program, professional goals, and other matters that would help the Admissions Committee evaluate his/her aptitude for advanced academic work and research. Preference is given to applicants who express clear plans and an understanding of the field of Ethnic Studies. Applicants whose undergraduate majors may not be directly relevant to Ethnic Studies should give an account of their decision to pursue the field. This statement should be no longer than two pages. &nbsp;</p>
	</li>
	<li><strong>Personal&nbsp;Statement: &nbsp;</strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;The personal statement should reveal aspects of the applicant's individual self and experiences that motivates&nbsp;&nbsp;their academic&nbsp;potential, and attests to their ability to thrive as a scholar and&nbsp;member of the UC Berkeley&nbsp;community.&nbsp;This statement should be no longer than two pages. &nbsp;For more information, visit&nbsp;<a class="external" href="http://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/apply/personal-statement/" target="_blank">http://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/apply/personal-statement/</a>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<span style="color:#FFFFFF">.</span> &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</li>
	<li><strong>Writing&nbsp;Sample:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;The writing sample should be an expository piece about 20 pages in length that can showcase the applicant's ability to conduct research, sustain an intellectual analysis, and make a persuasive argument using the conventions of academic discourse. The sample can be a complete paper, such as a term paper from a course; an excerpt from a longer piece, such as a chapter from a thesis; or an essay written specifically for the purpose of application. No more than two shorter pieces may be substituted for one 20-page piece, but the latter is preferred. Non-expository work, such as creative writing, journalistic writing, co-written pieces, etc., may be submitted in addition to, but not in place of, the expository writing sample. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<span style="color:#FFFFFF">.</span></li>
	<li><strong>Letters of Recommendation:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Please provide three letters from people familiar with your academic performance, ideally from tenure-track professors. Letters from graduate student instructors (teaching assistants), non-academic supervisors or employers will also be considered but don't carry as much weight as those from professors. Recent letters are preferred. If you are a re-entry student without recent letters from professors, please explain your situation in your statement of purpose. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; <span style="color:#FFFFFF">.</span></li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Match of research interest to faculty expertise and research interests:</strong><br>
	Applicants who are academically superior but whose research interests are a poor match with the expertise and research interests of the faculty will not necessarily be selected.</p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Promise of extending Ethnic Studies scholarship:</strong><br>
	Preference is given to applicants whose proposed research promises to move Ethnic Studies scholarship in new directions.</p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disadvantages overcome:</strong><br>
	The Admissions Committee takes into consideration significant socioeconomic and educational disadvantages overcome by an applicant, with a view to enhancing graduate student diversity.</p>
	</li>
	<li>
	<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Record of community service:</strong><br>
	The Admissions Committee takes into consideration an applicant's track record of serving various communities, such as student populations, disadvantaged groups, ethnic communities, etc., with a view to enhancing graduate student diversity.</p>
	</li>
</ol>

<h3 id="3" style="text-align: justify;">Program Requirements</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">See full information on degree requirements on the <a href="/courses/graduate">Graduate Courses page</a> or consult the <a href="/documents/all2010HandbookRevision.pdf">Graduate Handbook</a>.</p>

<h3 id="4" style="text-align: justify;">Financial Aid and Tuition:</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">See information on <a href="/grad/tuition-financial-aid">Financial Aid page</a>.</p>

<h3 id="5" style="text-align: justify;">STEP by Step</h3>

<p style="text-align: justify;">To learn how best to prepare oneself for study at the graduate level in the humanities and the social sciences, current undergraduates may find useful <a class="external" href="http://stepbystep.berkeley.edu/" target="_blank">STEP by Step</a>, a planning tool developed by Josephine Moreno and Gloria Chun, the Graduate Diversity Coordinators in the Arts and Humanities and the Social Sciences.</p>

<h3 id="6">Questions?</h3>

<p>See FAQ or <span style="font-size:16px">contact the Ethnic Studies Admissions Office, <a href="mailto:msminor@berkeley.edu" target="_blank">e</a><a href="mailto:es-admission@berkeley.edu">s-admission@berkeley.edu</a></span></p>
</div>
<!-- end code region pod_3411484 -->

      <h2 class="text-left" aria-hidden="true"><a href="/"><span>The Department of </span> <span class="bigger bold">Ethnic Studies </span><span>UC Berkeley</span></a></h2>
    
  </header>
